slides.title: Historical Correlation
slides.content: Gold has historically shown a negative correlation with USD strength, making it an effective hedge against currency fluctuations. Recent data shows this relationship strengthening during periods of market stress.

slides.title: Indian Market Impact
slides.content: India's gold demand significantly influences global prices, with rupee exchange rates playing a crucial role in local market dynamics. The country accounts for approximately 25% of global gold demand.

slides.title: Investment Implications
slides.content: Understanding the USD/INR and gold price relationship helps optimize entry and exit points for gold investments. Current trends suggest strategic accumulation during rupee strength periods.

slides.title: Risk Analysis
slides.content: Market volatility in 2024 suggests maintaining a 10-15% gold allocation in diversified portfolios. This provides both crisis protection and potential appreciation opportunities.
